query: Give me the steps from your content to enable Micrometer tracing in Spring Boot.
actual_response:
To enable Micrometer tracing in Spring Boot, follow these key steps derived from expert content on Spring Boot observability and tracing:

Add Required DependenciesInclude the Spring Boot Actuator and Micrometer Tracing dependencies in your project. For example, add the Micrometer Tracing starter and any tracing bridge you want to use (such as Brave, Zipkin, or OpenTelemetry) to your pom.xml or build file. This sets up the foundation for metrics and tracing support in your application.

Enable Spring Boot Actuator EndpointsConfigure your application to expose Actuator endpoints, which provide access to metrics and tracing data. For example, in your application.properties or application.yml, enable the necessary endpoints and configure security accordingly to protect sensitive information.

Configure Micrometer TracingUse Micrometer Tracing to capture distributed traces. This can be done by adding the Micrometer Tracing module and configuring a tracing bridge such as Brave or OpenTelemetry. For example, you can configure the tracing bridge to export traces to Zipkin or Jaeger.

Instrument Your Application  

Automatic Instrumentation: Many Spring Boot components (like REST controllers, WebClient, RestTemplate) are automatically instrumented for tracing when Micrometer Tracing is enabled.  
Manual Instrumentation: For custom tracing, use annotations like @WithSpan or inject a Tracer bean to create and manage spans programmatically in your code.


Configure Logging for Trace CorrelationEnhance your logs by including trace and span IDs. This allows you to correlate logs with traces for better observability. Spring Boot supports this out of the box with Micrometer Tracing and logging patterns that include trace identifiers.

Export Traces and MetricsConfigure exporters to send your tracing data to backend systems such as Zipkin, Jaeger, or OpenTelemetry collectors. Similarly, metrics can be exported to Prometheus or other monitoring systems.

Visualize and MonitorUse tools like Zipkin, Jaeger, Grafana, or Prometheus to visualize traces and metrics. This helps in diagnosing performance issues and understanding request flows across distributed services.

Example Configuration SnippetIn application.properties or application.yml, you might have:  
management.endpoints.web.exposure.include=health,info,prometheus,trace
otel.sdk.disabled=false
otel.service.name=your-service-name

And in your build file, include dependencies for Micrometer Tracing and your chosen tracing bridge.

Run and TestStart your Spring Boot application and generate some traffic. Use the tracing UI (e.g., Zipkin or Jaeger) to verify that traces are being captured and exported correctly.


These steps are based on practical guidance from Spring Boot observability sessions and tutorials, emphasizing the integration of Actuator, Micrometer, and OpenTelemetry or Brave for tracing in modern Spring Boot applications [1.], , , , , .
In summary, enabling Micrometer tracing in Spring Boot involves adding the right dependencies, configuring Actuator endpoints, setting up tracing bridges, optionally adding manual instrumentation, correlating logs, exporting data to observability backends, and using visualization tools to monitor your distributed system effectively.
